message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: 
```java
import java.io.*;
import java.util.*;

public class ToDoList {
    private List<ToDoItem> items;
    private Scanner keyboard = new Scanner(System.in);

    public ToDoList() throws FileNotFoundException {
        items = new ArrayList<>();
        File file = new File("ToDoItems.txt");
        Scanner readFile = new Scanner(file);
        while (readFile.hasNext()) {
            String line = readFile.nextLine();
            StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(line, ",");
            while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
                int id = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken().trim());
                String description = st.nextToken().trim();
                items.add(new ToDoItem(id, description));
            }
        }
    }

    public void addItem() throws FileNotFoundException {
        PrintWriter fout = new PrintWriter(new FileOutputStream(new File("ToDoItems.txt"), true));
        System.out.println("add to the list? [y/n]");
        String inputline = keyboard.nextLine();
        while ("y".equals(inputline)) {
            System.out.println("Enter id: ");
            int id = keyboard.nextInt();
            keyboard.nextLine(); // consume newline
            System.out.println("Enter description: ");
            String description = keyboard.nextLine();
            items.add(new ToDoItem(id, description));
            fout.println(id + ", " + description);
            System.out.println("add more to the list? [y/n]");
            inputline = keyboard.nextLine();
        }
        fout.close();
    }

    @Override
    public String toString() {
        return "ToDoList{" + "items=" + items + '}';
    }
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: 
In the given code, I have used StringTokenizer.nextToken to parse the id and description from each line of the file. The delimiter used is a comma (,). The parsed id and description are used to create a new ToDoItem object which is then added to the items list. The addItem method is used to add new items to the list. It prompts the user for an id and description, creates a new ToDoItem object, adds it to the items list, and writes it to the file. The toString method is overridden to return a string representation of the ToDoList object.
